forecast.review: Both forecasters largely mirror my base-rate-first approach and the same key catalysts. Two useful additions: (1) explicit path dependence that the April month-end level sets the May hurdle; and (2) emphasis on CPI timing relative to the May close as a potential swing factor. I agree with their haircut to the 55–60% base rate given elevated valuations and VIX. No major new information shifts the balance materially, but the CPI timing and hurdle framing slightly sharpen the setup. Overall, their reasoning is coherent and consistent with mine.
forecast.rationale: I continue to anchor on the historical slight positive skew for monthly S&P 500 moves, then reduce for current uncertainties: rich valuations and elevated volatility make the distribution fatter and more sensitive to rates/inflation surprises and Fed tone. The cluster of early-May catalysts (mega-cap earnings, PCE, ISM, payrolls, FOMC) keeps two-sided risk high. On the supportive side, recent momentum in large-cap tech and the possibility of non-alarming inflation prints alongside a patient Fed could be enough for a small monthly gain. On the risk side, sticky services inflation and higher-for-longer rates could compress multiples, especially if April ends at a high bar. Incorporating the other forecasters’ points (particularly the month-end hurdle and CPI timing), I make a small upward nudge but remain only modestly above even.
